page.title: 13THE DORNOCH FIRTH BRIDGE
page.content: {The A.9 is the main route from {Edinburgh to Wick.}It bypasses Inverness and it goes over the Kessock Bridge and the Cromarty Firth Bridge. The road then goes via Tain and on round the{Dornoch Firth,}passing through{Bonar Bridge.}To shorten the journey north a bridge is going to be built across the Dornoch Firth. Then, this year (1985) a proposal was made for a railway line to go over the bridge also. A lot of tourists on the A.9 call in at Bonar Bridge and when the bridge is built it might take a lot of the summer trade away from Bonar. The hotels would suffer from lack of trade. The other businesses would also suffer. So the{Community Council}are going to look into the problem of attracting tourists to the area.
